Reviews.Content: Definately recommend this place...would stay there again This was our first trip to Bali and I think this hotel was perfect, we stayed in S block and thought the room was big and was very new. The pools were very clean and huge!!! Only thing about the place is the breakfast and restaurant, we didn't care for the breakfast menu very much, although there was a good selection and did not like the food at all in the restaurant, but there are great restaurnants that are cheap near by. And be careful, when we were checking out they tried charging us for someone else's room service, even though it was two completely different names on the bill. But if we ever go to bali again this is where we will be staying for sure.
Reviews.Author: eviestevieBrisbane

Reviews.Content: Four Stars for the Price of Three! We just loved our stay at the Hotel Kumala Pantai. The beach-front location was great. The room was beautiful. The included buffet breakfast was delicious had a great range to choose from. The pool  lush tropical gardens were especially stunning. The service was always friendly and helpful. And all of this at a very reasonable price!There does seem to be a bit of confusion on Trip Advisor regarding this hotel. The website calls this place the 'Kamula Hotel', were as I (and apparently the majority of people on this site) are talking about the Hotel Kumala Pantai (www.kumalapantai.com). Whereas, the actual Hortel Kumula is an apparently smaller and cheaper establishment next door (www.hotelkumala.com). The two hotels appear to have the same ownership.
Reviews.Author: BenAndKylie

Reviews.Content: Surprisingly Great Hotel I go to Bali once a year and for this year trip, we were recommended by our friend to stay in Kumala Pantai, they even pre booked our stay. I was pleasantly surprised with Kumala Pantai hotel, the price was very cheap and yet the hotel was very nice! The location was great, the beach was only a step away from the hotel. There are many nice restaurants and bars within walking distance. 24 hrs shop is only 2 minutes away, it' was very handy! The atmosphere in Legian is far more relaxed and up market in comparison to Kuta beach.The room was clean and quite big. We had a patio in our room.The bathroom was great, the have both bath and wet room shower! They have big swimming pool with loads of sun decks and children swimming area. The garden is well maintained and very green.Breakfast was good with plenty of variety of hot and cold foods.Great value for money and quality!
Reviews.Author: miggies

Reviews.Content: Worth staying here hi - I would recommend this property. We were pleasantly surprised that, despite paying such a low price, we had a wonderful, relaxing stay. I like that we had a balcony, a clean and very large room, a beautiful and clean bathroom, and that huge pool. It was always warm and we even went swimming in the evening (even though it closes around 8 PM). Somedays, when we were so relaxed we didn't want to leave the room, we would call in for room service, and it would be delievered within 20 minutes. The breakfast was....okay. I mean, it was free and fresh, but the same thing every day (which affects you when they don't have a huge selection). The Italian restaurant that is in the hotel isn't that great, but on the other hand, just outside the hotel there are some fabulous choices for restaurants. I also really love that, the minute you step outside the back of the hotel, there is an AMAZING beach! This hotel caters to you so much - my only problem throughout my stay there was whether to spend time at their fabulous pool or the fabulous beach! It is in Kuta, which initially made me a bit apprehensive, but it is on the border of Legian - and walking distance to all those great rows of shops. This is a winner of a hotel - even though you pay so little, you do not sacrifice any of the luxury of a more expensive hotel. We would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: EdgeofExistence

Reviews.Content: Better than Expected       Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Baron45

Reviews.Content: Loved it! We just returned from a 16 night stay at the Kumala Pantai and we loved it. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and spacious.The pools are fantastic and huge and the gardens are some of the most beautiful I have ever seen in Bali. Breakfast was good. We were there during peak season and the hotel was fully booked but you would never know it, you could always find a pool chair. The staff were all really nice ans very helpful.Will definately stay there again.
Reviews.Author: bailey75

Reviews.Content: disapointed We stayed for eleven days family of five children aged 5,9 and 13 years. Had heard so many great reviews but wasnt to happy when I arrived. We paid 160 us per night for the ambassodor rooms (2 rooms with a loung/dining in the middle). Both bathrooms were full of mould and the mirrors deteriating and a generally scungy smell in both rooms, towels were very sad but our sheets were good. In the childrens rooms the walls were filfthy I asked for them to be cleaned on arrival they wiped it over which did nothing, curtains ripped chipped walls and very tired indeed, I requested other rooms but the hotel was full. The balconies were a treat listening to the pounding surf and bird life with the very lovelly gardens, room service was very good and the beds were the hard type's but we are ok with that. Breakfast was great the music was a bit loud for me and I love balinese music. Lots of expensive resaurants along the beach compared to other places we have stayed however the food was great, the beach was also very relaxing in one day I was asked by 20 people to buy stuff but they didnt hassle me except the little kids one who swore at us as well we were very polite to him(what a shame eh)The beach guys were very fun and our children loved the swimming pools as we did, lots of aussies with families whilst school hols was on. We decided we loved staying in poppies lane 1 better for location and eating but thats just us. Staff were great but the hotel couldnt do any of the famous cocktails for lack of alcahol with the muslim festival I was disapointed in general but can understand the appeal to many others of this hotel, a bit of paint and elbow grease would make a difference. We stayed opposite the white horse on the second level in the old building arjuana block. Sorry wont stay again.
Reviews.Author: nene66

Reviews.Content: Loved the swimming pool       Pool viewed from Y block
Reviews.Author: Ursie57

Reviews.Content: Great Value and picturesque gardens We stayed the the Kumala Pantai for a few days at the beginning of our Bali trip. It's a short taxi ride from the center of Kuta, which we found ideal. Try and get a room in the new building: we stayed in an older room, which was fine, and were moved to a newer room a few days later, which was even better. Very clean, the staff is very helpful and friendly and the pools are set in very picturesque gardens. Breakfast was ok, not amazing, but fine. Overall great value!
Reviews.Author: starfruitsalad

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Bali We had a wonderful time in Bali while staying @ the Kumala Pantai in Legian. My family and I were very fortunate to be one of the first families to actually stay in their newly opened section of the Motel/Hotel in April of 2008.We couldn't speak more highly of the place and the service we received whilst staying there. It was not only new and naturally comes with that a few teething problems, but it was beautiful. We had clean linen and room service daily. The new area is very well put together, just a lovely place to stay while visiting in Bali. It is central to all places of interest with a great selection of shopping and places to eat out very close.The rooms where lovely and the new pool area magic! So beautiful, we felt truely blessed and so pleased our friends and travel agent had recommended the Kumala Pantai to us.So go and stay there, we are sure you will love it too...Desi and her staff are just lovely...
Reviews.Author: mdcrabx4

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Perfect Me and my husband stayed at the Kumala Pantai from 31 August until 7 September (we were in Bali for a friends wedding) and I could not fault the place. It was absolutely perfect. We stayed in the old wing and a friend of ours stayed in the new wing. I had the opportunity to view both rooms and both were fantastic. The hotel staff and security were helpful and polite. Both pools (in the old and new wings) were amazing and the service throughout, excellent. The hotel is located in a very convenient location with markets just around the corner and a beautiful restaurant on the beach (also a really nice one next door). I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering travelling to Bali. I know that we will be staying here again next time. Perfect holiday.
Reviews.Author: Part78

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Stayed 3 nights at the Kumala Pantai in September 08. Great location, good restaurant, gardens beautifull. We stayed in junior deluxe suite approx $110 per nite. Room nice and good value for the money. Good privacy with lovely gardens, and a complimentary clothes drying rack. Our biggest disapointment was that when we had first night there after having a night out and returning at midnight my wife said I think the sheets are dirty . We confirmed this 2 be true the following morning as the room service cleaners put fresh sheets on our bed with creases where they had been folded up clean. YUKKK....We were a little disjointed when we arrived here as we had just bailed out of the Pelangi Hotel and looking back I should have taken the Balinese factor into account a little more and gone through the room more thoroughly, but as we were made 2 wait several hours for the room 2b made up I assumed the sheets would be fresh. Oh well, you live and learn. Apart from that and the lack of pool deck chairs and towels (the hotel was booked out at this time) it was very nice. Hotel is considerably larger since last year and is rather inpersonal. We had heard rave reviews about Kumala Pantai ourselves but probably before the extension. Would recommend the hotel and stay again.
Reviews.Author: kintomani

Reviews.Content: Good budget accomodation Good location at the beach, great breakfast. Room was large and clean, a bit tatty at the edges. Towels and bed linen were gray and falling apart which put me off the whole room!
Reviews.Author: Clara29

Reviews.Content: enjoyed the stay Breafeasts were compulsory and quite monotonous. The linen was very grubby and the towels were definately not white! Bleach maybe! Preferably I would prefer to stay in the older section. As for the Umbrellas, Come on guys there is not enough to go around and of course there are the people who throw the towels on the lounges and go away shopping for hours. There is a time limit. Staff were delightful, the General Manager was thoughtful and listened to suggestions. Wester nAustralian youth '''stay at the Jayakarta please, please. Must be the rudest people in the world.Great Holiday. Close to great restaurants, dinner at this hotel is superb Oh! in the new section take your own hair dryers and have your laundry done outside of the hotel. Great staff, kind and friendly
Reviews.Author: stepmunster

Reviews.Content: Cleanliness was NOT a virtue We stayed for a total of three nights during Indonesia's Independence Day in mid August 2008, booking a total of three rooms of which one of the them was the Presidential Suite.While the pricing of the Presidential Suite (2 rooms with a large dining table, small kitchen and living room) was very reasonable at IDR1.8m or USD200 nett, the rooms were far from clean. Additionally, the A/C did not work and as we could not sleep due to the heat, we were forced to call the front desk at 2am. Luckily, the technician immediately came and fixed the A/C within half an hour.Upon arrival, we found that there were many dead mosquitoes in one corner of our room. We also found that the floors were dusty. Additionally, the towels were extremely worn and grayish/ yellowish in color - definitely in need of replacement.Other than that, the stay was ok since we spent most of our time outside the hotel anyway. The management was also cooperative when we asked for a late check out on the last day of our stay, and we were given until 3pm.
Reviews.Author: SoutheastAsiaSusan

Reviews.Content: ideal place to stay Being our 6th stay in bali, we decided to give this hotel a try via the net, they were great to deal with and all our requests were met. recommend this hotel to everyone
Reviews.Author: buggsusa

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Kumala Pantai We have just returned from 2 glorious weeks in Bali. We stayed at the Kumala Pantai which has a lovely beachfront location and close to market shopping and restaurants. We were travelling with our daughters aged 4 and 6 so needed to catch taxis to Matahari, Centro and other attractions as walking was to far for them.We stayed in an Ambassador Suite in the new wing around the pool. This was perfect for our family, very spacious and great value for money.The gardens are very well maintained and very pretty.I would definately recommend this hotel to families with young children as our girls made lots of friends at the pool.If you want a quieter stay, maybe stay in the older wings and relax at the old pool which is still beautiful.My only gripe would be that the showers were not always hot. But hey, that's Bali!!
Reviews.Author: andreaPerth

Reviews.Content: More than we expected. The hotel offers a lot for the money you pay. The rooms are spacious, with TV, air con, mini bar and a terrace. The bathroom is modern. The hotel is well kept, it has two swimming pools and is just in front of the beach. The restaurant of the hotel is very good, but you have other choices in the surroundings. We paid less than 50 euros for the room.
Reviews.Author: RJPabroad

Reviews.Content: nice hotel... satisfying My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night. Originally we were looking for a hotel in Kuta area, but we could not find any. However, the location turned out to be an ideal, right next to the beach. The surroundings have a tons of restaurants to eat. It is a little bit off from the crazy central area of Kuta but still has a lot of annoying vendors and cab drivers constantly trying to get your attentions. We had a deluxe room right by the pool on the first floor with a nice balchony . The room keeps privacy from the next door and the pool sides. Staff speaks excllent English and very helpful. It does not have a transpotation from/to the airport, so you have to arrange your own way to get there. the breakfast is on buffet. You can eat at their restaurant (Italian restaurant ) right by the beach. Foods are not excellent, but decent. After all, you could find a better hotel if you really look into or are willing to pay more, but this hotel is more than decent for the price.
Reviews.Author: demaru

Reviews.Content: Fantastic value and location, great hotel       hotel block
Reviews.Author: gwyn4940

Reviews.Content: Good value My wife and I stayed at Kumala Pantai Hotel for two nights during peak season in Bali. We were told that it was the last room available for the two nights we wanted. If the hotel was full, it certainly did not seem overly crowded. There was more than one pool. and the layout broke the hotel into many localized smaller units. Our room (Subali wing no. 11) on the second floor at the end of a wing was medium-large with a porch overlooking the pool. The air conditioner worked fine, and there was no noise from neighboring rooms. The TV showed HBO and several other premium channels with good quality picture. The refrigerator worked well, and a coffee/tea maker was provided. The bathroom was good-sized with both a tub and a standing shower. Unfortunately the smell of urine lingered in the bathroom during both days we were there. We asked the housekeeper to clean the toilet on the first day, but there was no change, so we assume our room was at the end of the building's drain for all the showers on the second floor. The buffet breakfast was included with the room. The quality of the food was adequate, and the setting was delightful--on the wide patio of the hotel's Italian Restaurant overlooking breakers washing the public beach across the street. The guests were well behaved and not too noisy when we were there. All in all, the hotel was a very good value for the money, and we would stay there again--but not in Subali 11.
Reviews.Author: Staidthere

Reviews.Content: Lost its Old Charm Stayed there from 8th to 12 th June .Stayed there twice before in a standard room and a suite but both times in the original old wing where the rooms front the garden and have nothing overlooking them .This time we could only get into the new wing which was full of Aussie Yobbos .Two new wiings 3 stories high face in to each other and al balconies look across a central pool to the other wing.Loud poll music all day making it impossible to rest in the afternoon . Where once this was a simple cheap and relaxed hotel it is now , unless in the old wing , a nasty cheap tour group hotel .
Reviews.Author: JDBFMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Best kept secret I have been to Bali on 12 previous holidays and have stayed at numerous hotels and villas over the years. Last time i was there i accidentally walked through this hotel and remembered how beautiful at night it was. This trip I had another 12 people who jumped on the band wagon for some fun and we were lucky that there were enough rooms for us at the Kumala Pantai. This hotel is the best kept secret the location is right on the beach the food at night in the restaurant is very very good and cheap. Breakfast is a bit basic but still has enough to fill you up. The rooms are basic but clean and for the price (A50 per night for a deluxe room) were excelllent value as all we did was sleep in them. The pool area is very peaceful and beautiful to laze around each day. We had a beautician out the back of the hotel for all our massages(A$8 per hour) transport no problem. Staff at front desk a bit basic on the old english but hey thats Bali !! Overall as per usual an amazing holiday if you do your research and I will be back as soon as we can manage some more cheap airfares for the now converted 12 people who came with me.
Reviews.Author: DBJovi

Reviews.Content: Loved It After a period away from Bali we decided to return to our favourite position and were not disappointed with the hotel. The staff were beautiful, breakfasts  dinner excellent and the new wing and pool were in operation. The only thing I would say is that the old wings are a bit tired and the lighting needs to be improved.
Reviews.Author: MoragMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Loved it! The hotel was unreal. I was told to go by a friend. The breakfast , the room and the staff, pool and bar were exceptional. The only downfall was the air-con in our room.There were only a few kids and they were well behaved. Perfect for a romantic get away or a honeymoon that we are planning for February, 2009.
Reviews.Author: Dubtah

Reviews.Content: Value for money WE have stayed at the Kumala Pantai hotel for the last 5 years, twice yearly we visit, once for a month in May- June and the other time November - December for around 14-17 days, we love it. My only thing negative to say would be ,the air conditioner in some rooms, they do not work that well. Staff do there best to get them running, however would have to say they need replacing, this is the only option.Many of my family and friends have booked and stayed at this hotel due to my recommendation of this hotel and everyone has said how it is good value for money.Love it and returning shortly again to be in the new section that's being built at present.Mrs Mc Forrestfield WA
Reviews.Author: setmac

Reviews.Content: perfect       the garden walk-ways
Reviews.Author: aceaj

Reviews.Content: Good value for the money When I first arrived in Bali, having never visited the country before, this was where myself and my partner stayed. I really didn't like it the first night, i found the room felt really damp and the AC was rattling and didn't work properly.So we checked out and tried a few other hotels in the area...funnily enough we ended up going back to the Kumala. Once u see what else is around for the money you quickly realise that this is the best for the budget traveller.We stayed there on three seperate occasions in 2 weeks. We quickly realised that the ground floor rooms seem to be damp so get an upper level room. The pool isn't the cleanest and there isn't much atmosphere but it's great for a cool down after the ebach.Legian beach is pretty nasty - very dirty and crowded. But if you walk out of the hotel onto the beach and turn right and walk for 5 or so minuted you'll reach Seminyak beach which is supposedly more upper class. There are far less tourists, hawkers and rubbish on this beach.The hotel is sort of in the middle of nothing in terms of good resturants and bars but u can get around cheaply in a taxi.The hotel clientele are mostly of the older generation but it's a nice and quiet, clean option.
Reviews.Author: Littlemisstourist

Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel Have stayed at kumula pantai last five years. was recomended by travel agent. the staff are fantastic, from reception down to the ground staff. i will be back in april with my daughter and g/daughter and july with a girl-friend.love the location, great to have a meal and look over the ocean, grounds of hotel are lush and green. huge pool, just love it. bali lover, Louise
Reviews.Author: laura1947

Reviews.Content: Really Good We stayed at Kumala Pantai in February. On arrival we had air conditioner problems, but a quick call to the front desk and maintenance was onto it in a flash. We recommend this hotel as it is just far enough away from the full hustle and bustle of down town Kuta , but not too far to get to.The staff were excellent and the hotel food very good, as was the enormous pool and hotel settings.As this was our first stay at the hotel on recommendations from friends we will have no problem booking again for our next trip to Bali.Can't wait for the new wing next door to be completed.wagener_racing@hotmail.com
Reviews.Author: kristofferson

Reviews.Content: Will redevelopment in 2007/8 change the Kumala Pantai? It is a little unfortunate that the overflow from the adjacent Jayakarta Hotel has found the idyllic Kumala Pantai. What once was a quiet hotel predominantly for older travellers ( due to the deep pool) has now been invaded by what i can only say is Aussie riff raff noisey family groups with teenagers who insist on doing bombies from the beautiful equestrian stature that is a feature of the hotel pool. Over the years we have stayed at the hotel, the breakfast buffet has not changed at all - but it really is quite delicious and the fruit buffet is wonderful. I love the KP and will keep on going back- this year I will be interested to see the major renovations that will have added a large number of rooms plus a pool with a swim up bar - I hope that this will not mean that the quiet and tranquil Kumala Pantai will not become just another haunt for the Aussie yobbo who seems to be found all over this beautiful island. We stayed at the Jayakarta but were put off by the noisey people drinking and partying on the balconies of rooms - hope that the KP maintains its standards. Apparently thr breakfast area is going to have to accommodate the increased rooms this year - good luck!
Reviews.Author: Regicia

Reviews.Content: Great stay at kumala       The pool
Reviews.Author: urbanmike

Reviews.Content: favourite hotel I have been to bali 25 times the last 5 at the kumala pantai,as an all round experience I love the kumala pantai.Location,room ( especially the ambassador suite),pool ,food and especially the staff are are excellent.that end of town is not as frantic as kuta and the eating in the vicinity is great.Any problems talk to the beautiful Desi in reception and presto they are fixed.Paul Williams Perth
Reviews.Author: PerthSandgroper

Reviews.Content: Nice Budget Hotel -January 2008       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: bitterpumpkins

Reviews.Content: Hard Bed - Hot Room We were disappointed with the Kumala PantaiWhilst the room size was great, and a bonus to have two showers, the beds were rock hard. After 3 nights and an aching back we made to the move to another hotel.Also, the air condition did not work very well, and so the rooms were also very hot.We found the staff not very helpful and also thought that the location was not the best, too far to walk to main part of legian and too far to walk to main part of Seminyak.... Disappointed also that the pool closed at 7pm.Better hotels around.
Reviews.Author: TANCHRIS

Reviews.Content: Quiet, a bit run-down We stayed in Junior suite with two young kids. The place was green with some fish ponds and close to the beach and shopping. Breakfast was average, aircon need overhaul (you would sweat inside the aircon), many mosquitoes (even at the reception). Beds are good, but there are some spider webs in the wood. Service is good and the Italian food in room service is good. At USD 90 we did not find it cheap or great value for money as some other reviews suggest. We thought it was better to spend additional USD 70 and take a five star accomodation.
Reviews.Author: rajesh0agrawal

Reviews.Content: Value for money! What a fantastic surprise when we saw the size of the Ambassador Suite- 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms ,living, dining. With 2 kids it gave us heaps of space to have our own privacy (and sleep-ins!) We barely knew the kids were there! The pool is huge. The restaurant out by the beach has a lovely view and the food is ok. Room service is inexpensive- a great option for those times when a siesta is in order. The breakfast buffet is fantastic too. The beach in front is great with lots of shade and activities. This location has some excellent restaurants and bars, perfect for sundowners. Just north of the hotel is a place called Goody's that do great pizza for about 22,000 for any topping. Kumala Pantai is a great budget hotel- I highly recommend it!
Reviews.Author: L.Northam

Reviews.Content: Loved it This hotel is excellent in every way. This was our second trip to Kumala Pantai and loved it as much as the 1st. Rooms good size, lovely and clean. with in room safe. Bathroom has both shower and bath which is pretty good for a mid rage hotel. Breakfast amazing, everything you would want and more to choose from. Excellent view looking out over Legian Beach.We stayed in block B both times, top floor and had an amazing view of the pool, which can also be seen from Block A.Daughter and her friend are staying there at the moment nov 07 for their second visit and are loving it.Excellent hotel for rooms, pool, where it is and the nice friendly staff.Will def be going back!!
Reviews.Author: thegm

Reviews.Content: Fantastic budget hotel       Pool
Reviews.Author: rach1565

Reviews.Content: great value i had 3 enjoyable stay at this hotel. at first, when my friend suggested i book this hotel, my reaction was ``what hotel? kumala pantai? never heard of it'' i often go to bali, flying from jakarta, but really, never heard of it. so, cos the price is very reasonable, i gave it a try. It was better than some more expensive hotels i had been to. I love sitting at the restaurant terrace watching the waves while eating buffet breakfast (dont expect a ritz/hyatt style, but was more than enough and more importantly: tasty). Then, for lunch and dinner, there are vast array of restaurants next to the hotel. to swim in the beach you just cross a 4-meter wide lane. so i loved this hotel.
Reviews.Author: safircraze

Reviews.Content: Unbeatable Value It is hard to imagine better value for money. Whilst this hotel is not the best that I've ever stayed in, for less than $70 AUD per night for a huge room with balcony and that stunning pool, it is very difficult to go past! Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: MarkFMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Great Beach Breakfast Hotel !! Just got back from bali last week.im a food lover, i must say Kumala Pantai exceeds my expectation.the room is OK, for the price you pay, its a bit outdated and it has a komodo dragon on the wall (kind of scarry at night after partyin). the hotel is nice in some way, its green, lush, n because of the 3 floor buliding blocks around the hotel, it gets shady in the day time, but its nice. the pool are in the front of the hotel, so you wont get a breezy pool lounging. Location is Great, for an adult this area is the perfect location to be, from day to dawn. next door to famous beach cafes and clubs, also a bit walk to legendary double six club. what not to love kumala pantai. The Best Part is.. The Breakfast.. yes it is. every morning, breakfast with beach views. Excellent breakfast ever yet in my life. sippin the coffee, watch the waves breaks, seeing the local peoples doing their things; setting up their business for the day (surfboard rental, etc) after the bfast closed, it began changin to an italian rest. i think it called the sands, i guess.. great food too. i actually not a breakfast person, but when you stay in Kumala Pantai, dont miss the breakfast. sometime the tables on the beach side is full. wake up early.
Reviews.Author: frozzty

Reviews.Content: Great Beach front hotel Excellent rooms with marble bathroom Ambassador (2 bedroom) suite was fantastic for us  friends. Good staff  grounds. Very large clean pool. Restaurant right on beach in very central area of Legian. Could not fault this hotel.Very good value for money
Reviews.Author: AliJAustralia

Reviews.Content: I will return again and again and....       Pool area at evening
Reviews.Author: bamse999x

Reviews.Content: Great Cheap Stay       The pool from our balcony
Reviews.Author: saesae

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Value Stayed at the Kumala Pantai in the Legian area of Bali from 1st to 5th September. The hotel is a short 15 minute drive from the airport (depending on traffic).Service at the front desk was satisfactory. We managed to get the room at the block we requested for (more on this later).We had a deluxe room (the cheapest at USD42 per night) which was well appointed and clean. The room had a TV set with more than 20 channels (CNN, BBC, HBO etc), an in-room safe, a balcony (though not much of a view). The attached bath had separate bath and shower facilities, a rarity for hotels of this range.Two issues bugged us on our first night. We discovered soon after that the digital in-room safe was locked. The hotel sent someone up shortly after a quick phone call and he opened it with a key after dismantling a panel on the safe. This was a little disconcerting as we were always under the impression that hotel staff wouldn't be able to open such safes so easily. We then followed the instructions (really carefully) to set a combination, but that failed to work. So we gave up. We were not going to spend precious holiday time fretting over a room safe - ended up leaving our passports and home currency in the safe deposit box provided free of charge at the front desk. The other lapse was the failure of the hotel to provide us with an adapter for our phone/camera chargers. Perhaps we are spoilt but we had never encountered any such problem in all our previous trips.Now that the minor lapses are out of the way, I have to say this is one fantastic hotel. The pool is a nice size and very well maintained, as was the hotel grounds. Beautiful Balinese sculptures are around every corner amid lush trees and foliage. Friendly smiles were on all the staff's faces.The hotel is divided into several blocks. The NS block (where we stayed) is the one closest to the beach. The A block is between NS and the pool, though you won't get any pool view due to the way the block is angled.The selection at breakfast was rather limited. There was an egg station, and about six other items plus breads, cereals and fruits. The six items varied a little over the four breakfasts we had, but it got a little bit tiring by the fourth day. Breakfast was served daily at the Ristorante Italia, a restaurant within the hotel premises that overlooks the (marvellous!) beach.One major factor for us choosing this hotel is its location. Its beach front entrance faces a beautiful stretch of Legian Beach. The same entrance is less than 50 metres from famous restaurants like Blue Ocean and Zanzibar. It is also 10 minutes away from the bustling Kuta where all the shopping and dining were to be had. A ride on the (ubiquitous) taxi to central Kuta costs only about Rp25,000. Also nearby were the more up-market nightlife and restaurants in Seminyak.You can rent deck chairs for the entire day at the beach right outside the hotel for a mere Rp40,000. Perfect for working on that tan and gazing at the magnificent sunset only Bali can offer.We requested for a late check-out on our last day as our departure flight was at 7:40pm. The rule is that you have to pay half of the daily rate if you want to check out by 6pm, about USD21 in our case. Still really inexpensive and it allowed us more time to savour our last moments on this beautiful island.Overall a real bargain for the wonderful amenities and service. We had a chance to sneak a peek at our friends' room at the Legian Beach Resort. It was smaller and more expensive (at USD88 a night). Fantastic value at the Kumala Pantai if there ever was one. We will definitely be back.
Reviews.Author: ooFlaneryoo
